abstract: Islamic State militant group alters ransom ultimatum, demanding that Jordan free failed suicide bomber Sajida al-Rishawi in exchange for Japanese hostage, and threatening to kill him and captured Jordanian pilot if demands are not met; many question why terrorist group is seek Rishawi's release now, since her failure to detonate her vest during 2005 attack in Jordan was an embarrassment.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State has said that if a failed suicide bomber, Sajida al-Rishawi, is not released by Jordan, it will kill a Japanese and a Jordanian hostage.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and RANYA KADRI

snippet: The Islamic State has said that if a failed suicide bomber, Sajida al-Rishawi, is not released by Jordan, it will kill a Japanese and a Jordanian hostage.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: All-but-Forgotten Prisoner in Jordan Is at Center of Swap Demand by ISIS
headline.print_headline: Failed Bomber Is Suddenly at Center of Swap Demand by ISIS
